TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit UpdateDelegateType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseDelegateType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to update delegate settings on a mailbox.

example.para: The following example shows you how to update delegate permissions on user1's account. User2 is granted the None permission level for the Calendar folder and is granted permission to view private items. User3 is granted Reviewer permissions for the Journal folder. Meeting requests are sent to the delegates and information about the request is sent to user1.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::DelegateUserType ^> ^ DelegateUsers { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::DelegateUserType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::DelegateUserType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a array that represents the identities of delegates to update in a mailbox. This property is optional.
Docs.value: The DelgateUsers property returns an array of that represent the identities of delegates to update in a mailbox.

remarks.para: If a delegate permission setting that is included in the SOAP request already exists in the specified mailbox, the setting in the mailbox will be updated with the value as specified in the request. If a delegate permission setting that is included in the SOAP request does not yet exist in the specified mailbox, the setting will be added to the mailbox. Any delegate permission settings that exist in the specified mailbox but are not included in the SOAP request will remain unchanged in the mailbox.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::DeliverMeetingRequestsType DeliverMeetingRequests { ExchangeWebServices::DeliverMeetingRequestsType get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::DeliverMeetingRequestsType value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a object that represents how meeting requests are handled between the delegate and the principal.
Docs.value: The property returns a object that represents how meeting requests are handled between the delegate and the principal.

remarks.para: The property affects all delegates in a principal's mailbox.
You must set the property to true so that DeliverMeetingRequests is serialized into the SOAPrequest.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DeliverMeetingRequestsSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The DeliverMeetingRequestsSpecified property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.
Docs.value: The DeliverMeetingRequestsSpecified property returns a Boolean true if is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request; otherwise, the property returns false.
